samples.comment: Starting off with a bot is bad enough. The it took a week to get a response and then longer to confirm what I knew already. Your app update wasn't compatible on iPads so I had a working app and then didn't and it took too long to hear from PG. I returned the amp.
Your AI support responded but did not resolve the problem, once the issue was forwarded on to your specialist support team there was no response at all, no help seemed to be forthcoming.
I prefer human answer rather than AI generate
The AI response was accurate, I just didn’t like the response.

It took 4 days and back and forth email questions that could have been answered with the very first support call. It was dragged out, really causing no musical experience to happen and causing dissatisfaction with the product and services. I can't honestly  say this was really a "good" experience, yes it eventually got resolved. But, ......why did you need me to repeat information over and delay this. I'm not a unicorn, this has happened before I'm 100% sure. As a senior software engineer, I would be fired for sitting on a simple registration problem like this for 4 days. Raise yourselves up people and understand, you're not going to be creating good word with turn-over like THIS. Take a moment to look at the original support request 556203 and ask yourselves, how you could have done better.

Have had an emailed update from micheal as to keep an eye out for update once this is done and can use my tablet again I will be happy to. I’ve had a bumpy start to my positive grid ownership first being sent a faulty unit by a large supplier returning and having to wait 20 days for a refund then ordered through an amazing supplier and started enjoying my amp brought battery and travel bag + spark control pedal and then this . If you can get this sorted will be a happy man
I don't want to deal with AI agents for support. PG make it impossible to speak to an actual person
The AI needs work.
I'm still waiting for a solution. Noone answered me except AI.
I received many suggestions, but they didn't solve the problem. This is the second time I've received a response, but this time I had to wait several days
The ticket was closed without resolving the issue, I have raised another ticket

Was sad to get an ai response, it also said tone cloud was still active yet after loading it a few times to even access tone cloud I couldn't reach any tones or download any of the few presets I could find.
You are sending me a survey to rate your service, but an actual person hasn’t responded or fixed my issue.   Seems preliminary to ask how the service has been.
The Problem has disapeared. No Action required. Support Suggestion from AI were completly based on Q&A - no new ideas.

We use Zendesk as well and are in the music industry 
While the Ai response were quick from you it was the last part of getting a RMA from I believe a real customer service person was the difficult part. It took almost 3 weeks. I complained several times and then got several RMA#s in a very short period of time...

response time is slow
AI bot is unhelpful 
Return policy for defective goods unsatisfactory
Only AI reply. Problem not solved

The spark says I have no WiFi—- wrong 
I get an error code of 1
Says there is no WiFi I’m on fiber optics and the WiFi is fine my phone and computer are both hooked up and working fine. 
Can you send me a link to update drivers and update the spark2 to the current software please.
Thanks John

I did not receive anything helful in that email from your ai agent. I obviously hate thia product because of that limitation and I can't use it as I should. I will start to make posts about how abysmal your support and your product.

I have not used the spark control pedal that much and for it to stop working and then ask for £40 to replace it is shocking. I only use the pedal at home, so I would be really angry if it failed during a gig

allComments.comment: I think this is a “new product” compatibility problem with the app and device. It only partially works. I think I need a human to help me.

well... the problem was fixed, so that's good. However, being told to follow a lengthy set of more and more impractical steps to try to solve the issue as if it was somehow a problem on my end, when it clearly was an issue regarding (and ultimately resolved by) a software "update" that broke the product, was a bad idea. It would be a lot better if, when you break something, which happens in software development all the time, you just own the problem, and work on a fix, instead of gaslighting your customers with impractical ideas like trying a different WiFi network, which of course, won't fix broken software anyway... it's just busy work.

So: very satisfied that you fixed it farily quickly, very dissatisfied with the initial response that this was an issue of my usage of the product. Hence, neutral. Love the product, though!

I'm still waiting for a solution. Noone answered me except AI.
Awful. Nothing is working to update my amp.  This is beyond frustrating. I've sent videos and multiple replies and no one is getting back to me.  This is ridiculous
I received many suggestions, but they didn't solve the problem. This is the second time I've received a response, but this time I had to wait several days
The ticket was closed without resolving the issue, I have raised another ticket

All of as sudden my product stops working. And it's my fault? Because my I phone is out of date. I have had my Marshalls 30+ years and never had a problem with things out of date. I think it's total BS. It's like you're forcing me to update for NO REASON. One day it works, the next day it does not.WTF??? Then I try and load it onto my BRAND NEW MAC (not cheap by the way) And it says sorry your device is not compatible. Then you offer me a 20 DOLLAR  GIFT CARD? Bullshit. I won't spend another dime on this asshole company. Very Very Very unsatisfied.

I think if the product has been discontinued you should provide the latest firmware and software. Because your EOL policy is unclear for our customer side at the moment when we bought them.
I just want to use my gear, not sure why it worked for as long as it did and suddenly i can't use my spark amp. Frustrating! I shouldn't need to be a computer nerd to play my music

I want a refund

I did not receive anything helful in that email from your ai agent. I obviously hate thia product because of that limitation and I can't use it as I should. I will start to make posts about how abysmal your support and your product.
i really need this amp becouse of country i couldnt get this .so please if you guys can do something then please help me

I have not used the spark control pedal that much and for it to stop working and then ask for £40 to replace it is shocking. I only use the pedal at home, so I would be really angry if it failed during a gig

1. My problem was not solved.
2. The advise given was missed.

I got an automated AI-generated response telling me that the problem with using my Spark Mini as an audio interface with my Mac needs to be fixed by Apple. This is not helpful. I don't think all audio interfaces suddenly stopped working in the new macOS update, so this _can_ be fixed by Positive Grid. Apple didn't suddenly kill support for audio interfaces. And they do months of beta testing, giving sufficient time for developers to update their apps/firmware/etc.

I had a prompt AI answer, the suggeted solution did not work, the Microsoft link ended in Nirvana territory. 
I was promised that the problem would be escalated to a real person, so far this has not happened.

A patronizing, automatic AI response summarizing my message, followed by my need to follow up after a week without a reply from a person, followed then by an additional three-day delay before a response was sent by a Positive Grid team member, totaled 9 days before I received a direct reply about the issue. A satisfactory resolution was not provided.

Overall, this was one of the worst examples of customer service I’ve experienced. Not only was interacting with Positive Grid deeply subpar, but it’s also given me a negative impression of your brand. If it takes 9 days for a response to the simplest of issues, then I have little confidence in receiving support should there ever be a matter of greater concern with one of your products. Beyond unacceptable and disappointing, and makes me want to sell all my Positive Grid gear.

After latest update m app wouldn't open. Received a quick response being told my ipad needed to be replaced and would not be able to run the software and I could not get a link to the version that did work ( previous update).. Days later received an email saying there would be an update that would fix the problem. The mixed messaging did not inspire trust or confidence in the software development or customer service
問題はまだ解決していません。評価はそれからです。
you've let down bias fx2 buyers. condemned not tu upgrade their OS. That was nasty of you
No reply from you
I understand that the product doesn't support my use case.  A link to create a feature request would be great.

In the latest release of the software I was forced to upgrade.  The upgrade would not work as apparently my IOS is too old.  It would be nice to have a published policy on how long the software would last. The solution given was to upgrade to IOS 15 (from IOS 12).  In order to do that I have to buy a new iPad so very costly.  I'd like a couple of things, one, don't force me to run an upgrade as the only option before starting the program and two would like to hear how you decide an operating system is too old.  It basically killed my iPad.  ios 12 support ended in 2023 and then was extended.  On the positive side on this ticket, when I submitted a ticket I got a response back in a couple of hours.  I had estimated it to be a week, so that part is good.  My question now would be if I buy a new iPad how long will Spark app be supported on it as the only function of my ipad is to run the Spark app (which is terrific by the way).  Thanks

Hi, im not PC programer " mkLink",  im customer,gitarist
....why don't direct instal way on C/PG....without problems with diacritical ????
Need a real customer support. Not AI answer

I love the speaker but this is the second one that I've had to return. The first had a hardware issue out of the box. The replacement has had connectivity issues throughout which have got progressively worse. I'd love one of your larger amps, but have decided not to buy one based on the issues I've had with the Spark Mini.
Regarding you customer service, your AI initially responded to my request asking me questions I had already answered. I responded by asking to speak to a human, and your AI responded to that saying it was a human. I found that whole interaction frustrating.

To sum up, the amp sounds great but I won't be buying another Positive Grid product

Initially the AI gave various things to try to fix problems connecting bluetooth.  It worked once but then did not work.  I started getting a screen that said "Successfully Connected" but not a screen where I could pick an amp and start to play.  Infuriating!  I then asked for a human and AI said someone would get back to me.  This was several days ago.  I got an email yesterday saying that someone would help me but they had a lot of requests.  I'm not that tech savvy (I'm 74 years old) but I've tried many times to resolve the issue on my own without success.  It's unfortunate because the spark 40 amp is really awesome when it's working properly.
